intro: Gomphia tomentella, commonly known as the woolly gomphia, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Restionaceae and is characterized by its dense, woolly covering on its stems and leaves. Gomphia tomentella is often found in coastal fynbos vegetation and is adapted to withstand salt spray and coastal winds.
